definitions.definition: To draw together or nearer ; to shorten , narrow , or lessen .
examples: The snail’s body contracted into its shell.
to contract one’s sphere of action

definitions.definition: To shorten by omitting a letter or letters or by reducing two or more vowels or syllables to one.
examples: The word “cannot” is often contracted into “can’t”.

definitions.definition: To make an agreement or contract; to covenant .
examples: The company contracted with the council to build 200 new houses.

definitions.definition: To enter into a contract with (someone or something).
examples: We have just contracted new pest control services.

definitions.definition: To enter into (an agreement) with mutual obligations; to make (an arrangement).
To bring on; to incur; to acquire.
examples: She contracted the habit of smoking in her teens.

definitions.definition: To draw together so as to wrinkle; to knit.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To draw together or nearer ; to shorten , narrow , or lessen .
secondary_definitions: ( grammar ) To shorten by omitting a letter or letters or by reducing two or more vowels or syllables to one.
( intransitive ) To make an agreement or contract; to covenant .
( transitive ) To enter into a contract with (someone or something).
( transitive , archaic ) To enter into (an agreement) with mutual obligations; to make (an arrangement).
( transitive ) To bring on; to incur; to acquire.
( transitive ) To gain or acquire (an illness).
To draw together so as to wrinkle; to knit.
